ingredients.content: 20 g fresh root ginger, peeled, cut in round slices (2 mm)

preparations.content: Place garlic in mixing bowl and chop <b>3 sec/speed 5<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add soy sauce, water, vinegar, oil, spring onion, sugar, sesame seeds and chilli flakes then mix <b>10 sec/speed 3<b>. Transfer to a small bowl and set aside. Clean mixing bowl.
Place garlic and ginger in mixing bowl then chop <b>3 sec/speed 5<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula then chop again <b>3 sec/speed 5<b>.
Add flour, cornflour and salt then mix <b>5 sec/speed 5<b>.
Heat oil in a frying pan (Ø 23 cm) over a medium heat. Place 5 spring onions, 125 g prawns and ½ chilli in the pan. Drizzle over half pancake mixture, filling any gaps, then pour over 1 beaten egg.

When pancake looks almost cooked (3-4 minutes), flip over and cook for a further 3-4 minutes until edges are crispy and browned. Transfer to a chopping board, covering to keep warm, then repeat with remaining 5 spring onions, 125 g prawns, ½ chilli, remaining pancake mixture and 1 beaten egg to make a second pancake.
Using a sharp knife, slice pancakes into squares then serve immediately with reserved dipping sauce.
